revised_title: Observations of the Winter Solstice of 1812 and the Mural Circle at Greenwich
tldr: In 1800, John Pond observed the winter solstice of 1812 at the Mural Circle in Greenwich. Due to unfavorable weather, he could only obtain eight observations of the sun. The deduced obliquity of the ecliptic at the late solstice was 230° 27' 471"35. The small discordance with the summer solstice could be resolved by modifying Bradley's refractions, but the Astronomer Royal needed more data before making any corrections.
